page.title: 06The Broome; a typical farm
page.content: Broome Farm is mechanised and employs only two labourers. Its 360 acres are divided 120 barley, 100 silage, with the rest grazing, they no longer grow sugar beet. Most of the barley is used to make cattle cake. 130 Friesians of the dairy unit and 60 "followers" are kept inside between October and April. The 50 head beef unit stay inside all of the time. A Welsh farmer rents winter grazing for 150 sheep. Unlike most local farmers, they use AI to put cows in calf. Heifers produce Limousin crosses in August or September which go into a beef unit while the rest of the dairy unit calf between October and December.This ensures a year round supply of milk to the local dairy at Ellesmere. The cows are milked twice a day and, at present, the farm is above its EEC quota.Old cows and beef cattle are sold at Oswestry market.
